snippet: A recent report on sea piracy was greeted with nearly unanimous acclaim, with headlines proclaiming that commercial cargo ships had faced fewer attacks in 2011 than in the previous year. It was the first decline in five years. So, are the high seas...
abstract: A recent report on sea piracy was greeted with nearly unanimous acclaim, with headlines proclaiming that commercial cargo ships had faced fewer attacks in 2011 than in the previous year. It was the first decline in five years. So, are the high seas safer? Not necessarily.
lead_paragraph: A recent report on sea piracy was greeted with nearly unanimous acclaim, with headlines proclaiming that commercial cargo ships had faced fewer attacks in 2011 than in the previous year. It was the first decline in five years, the International Maritime Bureau said in its annual survey.

headline.main: A Slight Lowering of the Jolly Roger
